If you're not playing with FAR , then I recommend installing CorrectCoL.   The blue indicator in the VAB only takes account of aerodynamic forces from wing & control surface parts by default, CorrectCoL makes it take account of forces acting on all parts of the aircraft (your plane has more fuselage in front of CoM than behind it),  and it also gives you a static analysis graph,   so if the main wing is stalling before the canards and causing dynamic instabilty, this will also show up.
where is the dry CoM?
The further back you move the wings the harder it will be to turn, and the less likely it will be to backflip. It's a tradeoff.

Excessive drag ahead of the CoM can also cause a plane to flip.  You have your air intakes ahead of the CoM which can be pretty draggy (however they are pretty close to the CoM so the effect should be lessened).  There also may be something odd about that cockpit causing more drag than there should be, mod parts are often questionable (not saying there definitely is, but it could be).  It;s hard to see, but it almost looks like that cockpit has a built in air intake underneath.  Is that true?  If so that intake so far forward of the CoM is probably the cause.
